Different argument. Can't stop pursuing good ideas because of current gov prejudices. Joyce will be gone one day. @EricCrampton @Trabaq
I don't think you get what I'm saying: Just grant proportion of gst say 10% to all regional councils for local infra @EricCrampton @Trabaq
@EricCrampton Regional council level would sort that, no need to micro-manage.
Doesn't need to be that complicated @EricCrampton Tourist gst all goes to gov, no rebate, divide it up pro-rata.
Sales and fuel tax picks up both, it's property tax that doesn't @EricCrampton @Trabaq
@EricCrampton just a pro-rata distribution of 10% of gst to regional councils would go a long way to balance this; both for regions/cities.
Yeah no chance under current gov of say local sales taxes as in US to fund local infra @Trabaq @EricCrampton https://t.co/HhaHuCq8p1

@FrankMcRae easy, just start with wrong premise. No matter how smart you are after that; I always must be able to drive across LA unimpeded
@alevin @erik_griswold yes. My hunch is people will expect airline safety standards from AVs, not highway ones. This could lift whole game?
@alevin @erik_griswold and road engineering focussed on encouraging slower speed and greater safety and not traffic flow (and place quality)
@alevin @erik_griswold shame we don't think like with road transport controlled by meat computers: they're shockingly deadly.

@f_flipp @dewithiel which is, frankly, extraordinary; when else has so much political capital amounted to so little?
@f_flipp @dewithiel still; bike trails, followed by the urban cycleway programme about the only enduring/wholely positive outcome of PMship.
A great benefit of good cycling infrastructure is improved walking space, especially with separation... https://t.co/OPuVQUJ1zD
@f_flipp @dewithiel are really great, and strangely may well be the only enduring legacy of a wildly popular PM...
@JaqTweedie @daphlawless without user income how to pay drivers etc? More taxes? likely to be politically acceptable? Let alone expansion...
@daphlawless last point; it's really an argument for a static city with complete PT networks; how do fund expansion & improvements like CRL?
@JaqTweedie @daphlawless In AKL 50% of transit opex is paid by fares, 25% but other road users (fuel tax) and 25% by property owners (rates)
@JaqTweedie @daphlawless cost very important but is free always the best answer? unclear.
@daphlawless No time for that; you want to write one for the blog? Check out Talinin there's free transit for residents with a HOP-like card
@daphlawless lastly; fairness, it is fair that the user contributes to cost of service. How much of course matters hugely!
@daphlawless Better to target fare relief for young, old, poor, and offer off peak discounts to load shift. Currently all 65+ get free.
@daphlawless also it assumes poor are time rich, not true, often 2 jobs etc, what they really need is great safe efficient reliable service.
@daphlawless several problems 1. capture by those more than able to pay (eg me) 2. quality of service likely to plunge w/o source of funding
@daphlawless which contrary? They are the answer or not the answer? [I prefer cheap and targeted to free]
